central_thesis: The Scroll of Set (August 1985) emphasizes radical individualism, the embrace of one's 'dark actual self' and 'true sex' in magical practice, and the development of personalized operative systems within the Left-Hand Path framework. It critiques societal and conventional occult interpretations, advocating for discretion, self-possession, and the conscious creation of one's own magical reality for personal empowerment and self-deification.

structure_content.chapter_title: [1] Out of the Mouths of Babes: Salem Revisited
structure_content.summary: This article warns against societal paranoia and historical ignorance concerning Satanism and occultism, drawing parallels to the Salem witch trials. It criticizes news media and law enforcement for reacting to unsubstantiated claims and stresses the importance of discretion for Setians to survive and operate effectively amidst 'true believers'.

A direct invocation ritual addressing Set as Lord of Shadows, Prince of Darkness, and God of the Left-Hand Path. The practitioner seeks the Black Flame of knowledge, profound self-awareness, and freedom from fear, aiming to awaken the birthright of self-loving and to invite Set to dwell within.

structure_content.chapter_title: [3] Discovery of the Dark Actual Self
structure_content.summary: This article challenges traditional occult and spiritual philosophies that advocate suppressing one's 'true sex' or creating idealized gender images. It argues for the liberation and embrace of the 'dark, material, actual self,' integrating dynamic (masculine) and magnetic (feminine) energies without denying one's inherent nature, thereby achieving authentic self-realization and power within a Setian context.

A collection of aphorisms emphasizing themes of self-respect, individual distinctiveness ('separateness'), resilience, and the power of attitude and inner posture. These short statements reinforce the individualistic and self-reliant philosophy central to Setianism.

structure_content.chapter_title: [5] The Eye of the Beholder: Another View
structure_content.summary: This piece describes a personal ritual technique utilizing creative visualization. The practitioner conjures a 'glorious shadow' of a powerful mage during solo rituals to enhance self-confidence and reinforce the immense power inherent in their own 'raised self,' ensuring success and overcoming perceived limitations.

This extensive article explores the historical and practical applications of precious and semi-precious stones as amulets and talismans. It provides a framework for Setians to develop a 'psychecentric operant system' by combining intuition, scientific knowledge of crystalline structures and chemical composition, and creative visualization to 'tap' the energies of stones for self-alignment and personal power, explicitly stating that it offers a subjective ontology rather than universal truths.

key_concepts.definition: A term used within the context of the Temple of Set to refer to occult or magical practices, often associated with the 'Prince of Darkness' (Set), and frequently misunderstood or demonized by the profane public. It encompasses the pursuit of knowledge and power for individual self-enhancement.

A spiritual and magical philosophy, explicitly associated with Set, that prioritizes individual will, self-deification, and the conscious evolution of the self (Xeper) over conforming to external authorities, societal norms, or universalist principles. It emphasizes personal responsibility and self-mastery.

The authentic, material, and often instinctual aspect of an individual's being, including one's 'true sex,' which is to be embraced and integrated into magical practice. It is presented as a source of power and liberation, in contrast to suppressing or transforming it into idealized gender images based on conventional occult or societal expectations.

A personalized magical system for utilizing gems, developed by Setians, that combines intuition, scientific understanding of crystalline structures and chemical composition, and creative visualization. Its purpose is to create a 'subjective ontology' for individual self-alignment and power, emphasizing personal correspondences over universalist truths.
An object, often a gem, intended to preserve a person from trouble or to provide medical or prophylactic treatment, continuously exercising protective powers on behalf of an individual or thing.

An object, often a gem, specifically intended to perform one particular thing or task, such as procuring love, and is frequently engraved with a planetary sigil or other symbols to empower its function.

A core Setian concept representing the unique, individual consciousness, self-awareness, and inherent divinity within each Setian. It is the 'Flame of self-loving' that is kindled and awakened through personal effort and magical practice, fostering liberation from fear and limitation.

practical_system.description: The text presents several operative magical systems designed for individual empowerment and self-evolution. These include direct invocation of Set, integration of one's authentic self (the 'dark actual self') into magical practice, use of archetypal visualizations for self-confidence, and a personalized 'operant gemology' system. The overarching principle is the subjective creation of magical reality through conscious will, intuition, and carefully chosen correspondences, rather than adherence to dogmatic, universalist truths.
tools: Gems (various types, chosen based on intuition, crystalline structure, chemical composition, and personal correspondences)
Personal correspondences and self-developed subjective ontology
rituals: Invocation of Set: A ritual prayer addressing Set to awaken the 'Black Flame' of self-loving and to free the practitioner from fears, inviting Set's presence within.

Self-Integration Practice: Consciously embracing and expressing one's 'dark actual self' and 'true sex' within ritual, rejecting idealized gender images, to ensure an unfettered flow of personal energy.
Archetypal Visualization: During solo rituals, visualizing a 'glorious shadow' of the most powerful mage to enhance self-perception, reinforce inherent power, and ensure ritual success.

Operant Gemology: A personalized method for working with gems, involving holding a chosen stone in the left hand, 'pulling' its energy inward while inhaling, directing it to the 'heart' chakra, and allowing it to travel for alignment, using intuition, science, and creative visualization to build a subjective system of power.

relevant_quotes.text: Remember, just under the surface of a smiling, seemingly innocuous, earnest Christian lies the specter of those infamous words from the Holy Bible: 'Thou shalt not suffer a witch to live.'

Set, Lord of Shadows! Set, Prince of Darkness! God of the Left-Hand Path that I follow, awaken the birthright so long held in bondage. Kindle, O Set, the great Flame of self-loving, and free me from fears of failure and ruin. Enter and dwell within me forever.
The only 'obstruction' to my energy flow is when I attempt to deprive my own sensual self, punishing it for being what it is, while conjuring an impotent masculine image from within.
The best things and best people rise out of their separateness. I'm against a homogenized society because I want the cream to rise.

This system attempts to combine science with intuition in order to create an operant reality. It has no universalist truths. It is rather intended to create - and perhaps to communicate - a subjective ontology which, like Tarot, is used especially for the exploration of the practitioner's own psyche.

critical_analysis.relevance: This issue of The Scroll of Set is highly relevant to understanding the foundational philosophy and practical approaches within the early Temple of Set. It illustrates the organization's focus on radical individualism, self-deification (Xeper), and the conscious development of the 'dark actual self.' The articles contextualize Setian practices against external societal paranoia (Salem Revisited) and internal occult debates (Dark Actual Self), showcasing a unique Left-Hand Path paradigm. The inclusion of operative techniques like the Set invocation, visualization for confidence, and the bespoke 'Operant Gemology' system demonstrates the practical, subjective, and experimental nature of Setian magic in the mid-1980s.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of Initiates of the Temple of Set, practitioners of the Left-Hand Path, and individuals deeply interested in modern esoteric self-development, particularly those exploring the intersection of psychology, occultism, and personal sovereignty. It is also valuable for academics and researchers studying the history, philosophy, and practical applications within modern occultism and Satanism.
